p: Ash content showed an average of 3.1%. These results were similar to those of the pine nuts of P. pinea (1.9%), P. edulis (2.7%), P. koraiensis (2.2%), P. monophylla (2.4), and P. quadrifolia (2.4%), but these were lower than those determined for pine nuts of P. halepensis (7.4%), P. pinaster (4.6%), P. canariensis (4.8%), and P. maximartinezii (4.3%) [ 9, 10]. Loewe-Mu√±oz et al. [ 12] found an average of 4.4% of ashes in seed collected of three different macrozones of P. pinea in Chile, which is highest than values determined in our study.
